courses.name: Undergraduate Topics in Art History and Archaeology- Humanities
courses.description: Special studies in Art History and Archaeology.

courses.name: Introduction to Museum of Art and Archaeology, UMC
courses.description: This course is a brief introduction to the Museum of Art and Archaeology on Francis Quadrangle.  Special attention will be given to the history of the Museum, to its operation and to its collection.  Guest lecturers from the from the Museum will provide first hand accounts of their contributions to the day-to-day operations of the Museum and to the academic mission of the University.

courses.name: Giotto and the Arena Chapel
courses.description: This course is a brief introduction to one of the major monuments of western art, the Area (or Scrovegni) Chapel of Giotto di Bondone.  Special attention will be given to stories about him by Renaissance authors.

courses.name: Early Works of Michelangelo
courses.description: This course is a brief introduction to the life and work of Michelangelo.  Special attention will be given to his early works and to stories about him, especially those by Giorgio Vasari in his Lives of the Artist, Florence, 1568.

courses.name: Rembrandt
courses.description: This course is a brief introduction to the life and work of the seventeenth-century Dutch painter Rembrandt van Rijn.  Special attention is give to the appreciation of his art by his contemporaries.

courses.name: Undergraduate Topics in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Special studies in Art History and Archaeology.

courses.name: Ancient and Medieval Art
courses.description: Introductory survey of the architecture, sculpture and painting of the ancient Near East, Greece, Rome, Byzantium and Medieval Europe.

courses.name: Ancient & Medieval Art - Honors
courses.description: Introductory survey of the architecture, sculpture and painting of the ancient Near East, Greece, Rome, Byzantium and Medieval Europe.

courses.name: Ancient and Medieval Art - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Introductory survey of the architecture, sculpture and painting of the ancient Near East, Greece, Rome, Byzantium and Medieval Europe.

courses.name: Renaissance through Modern Art
courses.description: Introductory survey of architecture, sculpture and painting of Europe and America from the Renaissance to Modern times.

courses.name: Renaissance through Modern Art - Honors
courses.description: Introductory survey of architecture, sculpture and painting of Europe and America from the Renaissance to Modern times.

courses.name: Renaissance through Modern Art - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Introductory survey of architecture, sculpture and painting of Europe and America from the Renaissance to Modern times.

courses.name: Introduction to Asian Arts
courses.description: (same as HIST 1820, REL_ST 1820, S_A_ST 1152). This course is an introduction to the literature and visual arts of Asia through selected master works. It focuses principally on India and China and investigates the distinctive features of their cultures.

courses.name: Topics Art History and Archaeology - Humanities
courses.description: Study of special topics in Art History and Archaeology.

courses.name: The Art of the Book
courses.description: Introduction to the illustrated book as a locus of artistic style, cultural currency, and visual literacy.

courses.name: The Art of the Book - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Introduction to the illustrated book as a locus of artistic style, cultural currency, and visual literacy.

courses.name: Introduction to the Arts of Islam
courses.description: Architecture, decorative arts and painting of the Muslim world from the seventh to the 19th century. The formation of Islamic art and its relationships with religion, philosophy and symbolism.

courses.name: Introduction to the Arts of Islam - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Architecture, decorative arts and painting of the Muslim world from the seventh to the 19th century. The formation of Islamic art and its relationships with religion, philosophy and symbolism.

courses.name: Ancient Technology
courses.description: Engineering, architecture, and military technology in the ancient world.

courses.name: African-American Visual Culture
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 2720) This course introduces students to African-American art history, visual culture, and material culture in the cultural, political, and historical contexts. Specific focuses may include Harlem Renaissance, the Black Arts Movement, and other topics.

courses.name: African-American Visual Culture - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 2720) This course introduces students to African-American art history, visual culture, and material culture in the cultural, political, and historical contexts. Specific focuses may include Harlem Renaissance, the Black Arts Movement, and other topics.

courses.name: American Art and Architecture
courses.description: Architecture, sculpture, painting of America from 17th century to present day.

courses.name: American Art and Architecture - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Architecture, sculpture, painting of America from 17th century to present day.

courses.name: Introduction to Visual Culture
courses.description: Introduction to the problems of understanding, analyzing, and writing about visual culture.

courses.name: Introduction to Visual Culture - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Introduction to the problems of understanding, analyzing, and writing about visual culture.

courses.name: The Lives of Objects
courses.description: Introduction to the problems of understanding, analyzing and writing about decorative arts, design history, and material culture.

courses.name: The Lives of Objects - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Introduction to the problems of understanding, analyzing and writing about decorative arts, design history, and material culture.

courses.name: Archaeological Methods
courses.description: Methods of excavating various types of sites; recording, preserving their materials.

courses.name: Special Readings in Art History and Archeology
courses.description: Independent readings and research selected in consultation with supervisory faculty.

courses.name: Topics in Art History and Archaeology- Humanities
courses.description: Selected studies in various facets of art history and archaeology.

courses.name: Topics in Art History and Archaeology- Humanities - Honors
courses.description: Selected studies in various facets of art history and archaeology.  Enrollment limited to students with Honor's eligibility.

courses.name: Study Abroad in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Instruction in art history, architecture, or archaeology takes place in a foreign country or countries.  Trips are led and taught by University of Missouri faculty.

courses.name: Art and Gender in Antiquity
courses.description: Comparative survey of Egypt, Greece, and Rome, focusing on gender construction and cultural perception through material resources.

courses.name: Near Eastern and Egyptian Art and Archaeology
courses.description: General survey of material culture of the Near East and Egypt from the earliest times to the early Iron Age.

courses.name: Greek Art and Archaeology
courses.description: General survey of material culture in Greece from earliest times to the Hellenistic period.

courses.name: Roman Art and Archaeology
courses.description: General survey of material culture in the Roman world from earliest times through the 3rd century.

courses.name: Byzantine and Islamic Art and Archaeology
courses.description: General survey of the visual world of the Middle Ages in southwest Asia and the east Mediterranean, from late antiquity through the rise of the Ottoman empire.

courses.name: Byzantine and Islamic Art and Archaeology - Writing Intensive
courses.description: General survey of the visual world of the Middle Ages in southwest Asia and the east Mediterranean, from late antiquity through the rise of the Ottoman empire.

courses.name: Early Medieval Art and Archaeology
courses.description: An investigation of the arts of western Europe during the first millennium, when the unifying traditions of Rome were transformed by the diverse cultures of her Northern neighbors.

courses.name: Early Medieval Art and Archaeology - Writing Intensive
courses.description: An investigation of the arts of western Europe during the first millennium, when the unifying traditions of Rome were transformed by the diverse cultures of her Northern neighbors.

courses.name: Late Medieval Art
courses.description: General survey of European art and architecture from the 11th through the 14th centuries.

courses.name: Late Medieval Art - Writing Intensive
courses.description: General survey of European art and architecture from the 11th through the 14th centuries.

courses.name: Italian Renaissance Art
courses.description: General survey of the architecture, painting and sculpture of Italy from the 14th through the 16th century.

courses.name: Northern Renaissance Art
courses.description: General survey of northern European art and architecture from the late 14th through the late 16th century.

courses.name: Baroque Art
courses.description: General survey of 17th century European architecture, painting and sculpture.

courses.name: Cities in the Western Imagination
courses.description: Interdisciplinary introduction to the forms, functions, and meanings of cities in Europe and the Americas from ancient to modern times; plans and predictions for the future also considered.  Emphasis is placed on cities as fields for imaginative activity on the part of those who have designed, built, used, and interpreted them.

courses.name: Eighteenth Century European Art
courses.description: General survey of 18th-century European painting, sculpture and architecture.

courses.name: Eighteenth Century European Art - Writing Intensive
courses.description: General survey of 18th-century European painting, sculpture and architecture.

courses.name: Nineteenth Century European Art
courses.description: General survey of 19th-century European painting, sculpture and architecture.

courses.name: Nineteenth Century European Art - Writing Intensive
courses.description: General survey of 19th-century European painting, sculpture and architecture.

courses.name: Modern Art in Europe and America
courses.description: General survey of international directions in painting, sculpture, and architecture from 1885 to ca. 1940.

courses.name: Contemporary Art
courses.description: General survey of painting, sculpture, and architecture from the Second World War to the present.

courses.name: The Ancient World on Film
courses.description: (same as CL_HUM 3775 and FILM_S 3775) This course explores how classical antiquity has been represented in twentieth and twenty-first-century film, with particular emphasis on the ways in which ancient narratives and iconography have been appropriated by filmmakers to address contemporary cultural issues.
courses.recommendation: Prior 2000 level coursework in Classical Humanities, Art History and Archaeology, or Film Studies

courses.name: Architecture in Film
courses.description: (same as FILM_S 3780) Filmmakers use architecture to convey meaning on symbolic, psychological, and ideological levels.  Using architectural history and theory, in conjunction with weekly film screenings from a variety of genres, this course explores how architecture operates within film.

courses.name: Arts and Artists on Film
courses.description: (same as FILM_S 3785)  This course explores representations of art and artists in film, including documentary films, fictionalized films, and films made by artists.

courses.name: Indian Cinema
courses.description: (same as ANTHRO 3490, S_A_ST 3490 and FILM_S 3490).   Indian Cinema provides an overview of the key genres and themes of Indian film, including Bollywood, art cinema/parallel cinema, Indian regional cinemas, and diasporan cinema. The course combines film studies, anthropological, historical, and visual culture analyses to provide a holistic view of Indian culture and society through cinema.

courses.name: American Art and Culture, 1500-1820
courses.description: General survey of American visual culture - painting, sculpture, architecture-between 1500 and 1820.

courses.name: American Art and Culture, 1820-1913
courses.description: General survey of American visual culture - painting, sculpture, architecture, photography - between 1820-1913.

courses.name: American Art and Culture, 1913-Present
courses.description: General survey of American visual culture - painting, sculpture, architecture, photography, advertising, film, new media - between 1913 and the present.

courses.name: Topics in Art History and Archaeology-Humanities
courses.description: Special studies in art history/archaeology; covers subjects not included in regularly offered courses.

courses.name: Gender and the Arts
courses.description: (same as WGST 4120; cross-leveled with WGST 7120, AR_H_A 7120). Exploration of the relationship between the visual arts and constructions of gender and sexuality in selected eras.

courses.name: Archaeology of the Aegean Bronze Age
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7320). Analysis of the material culture of Greek prehistoric civilizations from 3000 to 1000 B.C.

courses.name: Greek Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7340). Survey of the art of building in the Aegean and Classical world from earliest times to the Hellenistic period.

courses.name: Greek Pottery
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7350). Examination of pottery and vase painting with an emphasis on production, iconography, and social context.

courses.name: Greek Sculpture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7360). Survey of sculptor's art in Aegean and Classical world from earliest times to Hellenistic period.

courses.name: Minor Arts of Antiquity
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7420). Discussion of selected minor arts and crafts of the Greco-Roman world.

courses.name: Roman Architecture
courses.description: (cross_leveled with AR_H_A 7440). The history of Roman architecture, origin and development of forms and techniques, major monuments in Rome and its provinces through the 3rd century after Christ.

courses.name: Roman Sculpture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7460). The origins and development of sculpture in the Roman Republic and the Roman Empire.

courses.name: Late Antique Art and Archaeology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7490). Exploration of the material culture of the Mediterranean world from the 3rd century to Iconoclasm.

courses.name: Byzantine Art and Archaeology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7510). Exploration of the material culture of the east Mediterranean between the 6th and 15th centuries.

courses.name: Art and Archaeology of Early Medieval Europe
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7520). Exploration of the material culture of western Europe from the 5th century to c. 1000.

courses.name: Romanesque Art and Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7530).  Exploration of topics in the art and architecture of Europe from the 10th through the 12th centuries.

courses.name: Gothic Art and Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7540). Exploration of topics in the art and architecture of the 12th through the 14th century.

courses.name: Michelangelo and the High Renaissance
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7620). Sculpture, architecture, paintings, and drawings of Michelangelo in the context of his times.

courses.name: The Renaissance Artist
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7630). Lectures, readings, discussions and a research paper related to the Renaissance artist. Focus will be on representations of the artist in art and literature from ca. 1300 to ca. 1650.

courses.name: Renaissance and Baroque Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7640). Problems in European architectural history from the 15th through the 18th century.

courses.name: Venetian Painting
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7650). Survey of Venetian Painting from the 14th through the 18th century.

courses.name: Art and Ideas in the Northern Renaissance
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7660). Discussion of selected topics in painting and sculpture and their artistic and cultural relationships from the 14th through the 16th century in northern Europe.

courses.name: Baroque Figural Arts
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7670). Painting and sculpture of Italy in the 17th century.

courses.name: The Arts of the Rococo
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7710). This course explores European Art from approximately 1710 to 1770, focusing on art associated with two different social sectors: The early modern aristocratic court culture whose artistic predilections had formed the European norm, and the increasingly powerful merchant classes whose newfound wealth enabled new artistic genres and styles to proliferate.  Our inquiry begins with an exploration of the rococo as an ornamental style; we examine its origins in Italian garden architecture and subsequent transformation into a decoration for both French palatial interiors and German Churches.  We then launch a succession of case studies of important artists, media, and objects in order to assess the varied ways that diverse social identities were deflected through the periods' art an architecture.  Students will pursue a research topic on rococo art for their semester project.

courses.name: Revolution and Romanticism: Art C. 1800
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7720). This course examines European art from circa 1780 to 1820, focusing on art made in conjunction with the major events of the French Revolution, its aftermath, and its global repercussions. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Realism Through Post-Impressionism
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7730). Styles and issues in nineteenth-century art.

courses.name: Modern Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7740). Problems in the history of architecture from the late 18th century to the present.

courses.name: Contemporary World Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7750). This course will study key themes, events, and figures in architectural theory and practice from around the world since the 1960s.  As with any course treating such a large body of material, this one will be selective topical rather than comprehensive in nature.  The format will include lectures, discussions based on reading, writing, and research assignments, films, and field trips.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Modern Sculpture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7760). Sculpture in Europe and the U.S. ca. 1880 to the present, with special emphasis on changing definitions of the medium.

courses.name: Advanced Course in Contemporary Art
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7780). Topics in European and American painting and sculpture after 1950.

courses.name: American Material Culture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7820). An exploration of American material culture from a multidisciplinary perspective.

courses.name: American Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 7840). An exploration of architecture and urbanism from the colonial period to the present.

courses.name: Special Readings in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Independent readings and research selected in consultation with supervisory faculty.

courses.name: Capstone: Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Students will write an expanded, guided research paper. The Capstone student will consult on a regular basis with the professor responsible for the course and will make an oral presentation of the paper in the course. Must be taken in conjunction with a 4000-level Art History and Archaeology course.

courses.name: Internship
courses.description: A one-semester or full summer intensive internship for departmental majors with specific projects and responsibilities to be arranged by the student in cooperation with a faculty member and an appropriate agent of the museum involved. May be taken as an elective only. May be repeated for a maximum of 6 hours credit.

courses.name: Honors Proseminar I
courses.description: Research methods, bibliography, use and criticism of source material.

courses.name: Honors Reading and Research I
courses.description: Individual research projects in preparation of senior thesis.

courses.name: Topics in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Special studies in art history or archaeology; covers subjects not included in regularly offered courses.

courses.name: Gender and the Arts
courses.description: (same as WGST 7120; cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4120, WGST 4120). Exploration of the relationship between the visual arts and constructions of gender and sexuality in selected eras.

courses.name: Museum Studies
courses.description: Functions and history of museums and interrelations among departments, including those of director, curator, registrar, education, conservation, and marketing. Topics include acquisitions policies; public outreach; role of architecture; and philosophical and legal issues pertaining to administration of museums.

courses.name: Historic Preservation
courses.description: (same as HIST 7450). Survey of the historic preservation movement and techniques by faculty and guest speakers active in the field.

courses.name: Archaeology of the Aegean Bronze Age
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4320).  Analysis of the material culture of Greek prehistoric civilizations from 3000 to 1000 B.C.

courses.name: Greek Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4340).  Survey of the art of building in the Aegean and Classical world from earliest times to the Hellenistic period.

courses.name: Greek Pottery
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4350).  Examination of pottery and vase painting with an emphasis on production, iconography, and social context.

courses.name: Greek Sculpture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4360).  Survey of sculptor's art in Aegean and Classical world from earliest times to Hellenistic period.

courses.name: Minor Arts of Antiquity
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4420).  Discussion of selected minor arts and crafts of the Greco-Roman world.

courses.name: Roman Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4440).  The history of Roman architecture, origin and development of forms and techniques, major monuments in Rome and its provinces through the 3rd century after Christ.

courses.name: Roman Sculpture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4460).  The origins and development of sculpture in the Roman Republic and the Roman Empire.

courses.name: Late Antique Art and Archaeology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4490).  Exploration of the material culture of the Mediterranean world from the 3rd century to Iconoclasm.

courses.name: Byzantine Art and Archaeology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4510). Exploration of the material culture of the east Mediterranean between the 6th and 15th centuries.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4520). Exploration of the material culture of western Europe from the 5th century to c. 1000.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4530).  Exploration of topics in the art and architecture of Europe from the 10th through the 12th centuries.

courses.name: Gothic Art and Architecture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4540). Exploration of topics in the art and architecture of the 12th through the 14th century.

courses.name: Michelangelo and the High Renaissance
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4620).  Sculpture, architecture, paintings, and drawings of Michelangelo in the context of his times.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4630).  Lectures, readings, discussions and a research paper related to the Renaissance artist. Focus will be on representations of the artist in art and literature from ca. 1300 to ca. 1650.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4640).  Problems in European architectural history from the 15th through the 18th century.

courses.name: Venetian Painting
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4650).  Survey of Venetian painting from the 14th through the 18th century.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4660). Discussion of selected topics in painting and sculpture and their artistic and cultural relationships from the 14th through the 16th century in northern Europe.

courses.name: Baroque Figural Arts
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4670).  Painting and sculpture of Italy in the 17th century.

courses.name: The Arts of the Rococo
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4710).  This course explores European art from 1710 to 1770, beginning with an exploration of the rococo as an ornamental language and then moving to case studies of artists, media, and objects in order to assess how social identities were expressed through design.

courses.name: Revolution and Romanticism
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4720).  This course examines European art from circa 1780 to 1820, focusing on art made in conjunction with the major events of the French Revolution, its aftermath, and its global repercussions.

As with any course treating such a large body of material, this one will be selective, topical rather than comprehensive in nature.  The format will include lectures, discussions based on reading, writing, and research assignments, films and field trips.  Graded A-F only.

courses.name: Modern Sculpture
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4760).  Sculpture in Europe and the U.S. ca. 1880 to the present, with special emphasis on changing definitions of the medium.

courses.name: Advanced Course in Contemporary Art
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4780).  Topics in European and American painting and sculpture after 1950.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4820).  An exploration of American material culture from a multidisciplinary perspective.

courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4840).  An exploration of architecture from the colonial period to the present.

courses.name: Archaeological Methods
courses.description: (cross-leveled with AR_H_A 4940).  Methods of excavating various types of sites; recording, preserving their materials.

courses.name: Special Readings in Art History or Archaeology
courses.description: Independent readings and research selected in consultation with supervisory faculty.

courses.name: Internship in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: A one semester or full summer intensive internship with specific projects and responsibilities to be arranged by the student and the program director.

courses.name: Master's Tutorial
courses.description: Consultation with faculty advisory and preparation of a scholarly essay based on a graduate research paper. Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: AR_H_A 8110, and other graduate courses in Art History & Archaeology

courses.name: Readings for MA Thesis in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Reading, critical evaluation of literature of special fields of art history and/or archaeology.

courses.name: Master's Thesis Research and Thesis
courses.description: Individual research leading to preparation of the M.A. thesis Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Introduction to Graduate Study
courses.description: Research methods, bibliography, use and criticism of source material. Required of graduate students in Art History and Archaeology who have not had AR_H_A 4996.

courses.name: Theories and Methodologies in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Literature of art and archaeology in terms of works of leading European and American art historians, archaeologists.

courses.name: Museum Studies Seminar
courses.description: Appropriate means for care and display of artifacts. Topics include: accessioning, cataloging, retrieval of information, and laws and ethics of collecting; the museum environment and its monitoring; condition reports, shipping and storage, and conservation. Field trips.

courses.name: Art Theory and Criticism
courses.description: Theoretical and critical literature of art from earliest times to the present.

courses.name: Historic Preservation Seminar
courses.description: Research techniques to solve research problems and conduct field recording in historic preservation, material culture, historic architecture, and cultural heritage studies.

courses.name: Seminar in Greek Art and Archaeology
courses.description: Special subjects of study assigned for individual research; discussion of reports by seminar members.

courses.name: Seminar in Roman Art and Archaeology
courses.description: Special subjects of study assigned for individual research; discussion of reports by seminar members.

courses.name: Ancient/Medieval Topography
courses.description: (same as CLASS 8440). Descriptive and historical analysis of a selected city or site. Subject varies.

courses.name: Seminar in Late Antique Art and Archaeology
courses.description: Special subjects of study assigned for individual research; discussion of reports by seminar members.

courses.name: Seminar in Medieval Art and Archaeology
courses.description: Specific subjects of study will be assigned to students for presentation in relation to broader questions of the cultural/ historical phenomena of the time, from ca 700 to ca 1400.

courses.name: Seminar in Renaissance Art
courses.description: Special subjects of study assigned for Northern or Southern Renaissance for individual research, discussion of reports by seminar members.

courses.name: Seminar in 18th Century Art
courses.description: Special subjects of study in 18th century art assigned for individual research; reports to be presented and discussed by seminar members.

courses.name: Seminar in 19th Century Art
courses.description: Special subjects of study in 19th century art assigned for individual research; reports to be presented and discussed by seminar members.

courses.name: Seminar in Modern Architecture
courses.description: Special subjects of study assigned for individual research; discussion of reports by seminar members.

courses.name: Seminar in Modern and Contemporary Art
courses.description: Special subjects of study assigned for individual research; discussion of reports by seminar members.

courses.name: Seminar in American Art
courses.description: Special subjects of study assigned for individual research; discussion of reports by seminar members.

courses.name: Readings for PhD Dissertation in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Reading, critical evaluation of literature of special fields of art history and/or archaeology.

courses.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research in Art History and Archaeology
courses.description: Individual research leading to preparation of the Ph.D. dissertation. Graded on a S/U basis only.
